contentItemData.label: AN1085: Using the Gecko Bootloader with Silicon Labs Connect
contentItemData.description: Includes detailed information on using the Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader with Connect. It supplements the general Gecko Bootloader implementation information provided in UG489: Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader User's Guide.

contentItemData.label: AN1119: Using RAIL for Wireless M-Bus Applications with EFR32
contentItemData.description: Describes using the Flex SDK for Wireless M-Bus development on EFR32 Wireless Geckos. Includes features and limitations as well as examples.

contentItemData.label: AN1127: Power Amplifier Power Conversion Functions in RAIL 2.x
contentItemData.description: Outlines how to account for the variation in output characteristics across custom boards and applications for the Silicon Labs EFR32 family of chips.

contentItemData.label: AN1135: Using Third Generation Non-Volatile Memory (NVM3) Data Storage

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Explains how NVM3 can be used as non-volatile data storage in various protocol implementations.

contentItemData.label: AN1154: Using Tokens for Non-Volatile Data Storage
contentItemData.description: Describes tokens and shows how to use them for non-volatile data storage in EmberZNet PRO and Silicon Labs Flex applications.

contentItemData.label: AN1190: Series 2 Secure Debug

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Describes how to lock and unlock the debug access of EFR32 Gecko Series 2 devices. Many aspects of the debug access, including the secure debug unlock are described. The Debug Challenge Interface (DCI) and Secure Engine (SE) Mailbox Interface for locking and unlocking debug access are also included.

contentItemData.label: AN1218: Series 2 Secure Boot with RTSL

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Contains detailed information on configuring and using the Secure Boot with hardware Root of Trust and Secure Loader on Series 2 devices, including how to provision the signing key. This is a companion document to UG489: Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader User's Guide.

contentItemData.label: AN1222: Production Programming of Series 2 Devices

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Details on programming, provisioning, and configuring Series 2 devices in production environments. Covers Secure Engine Subsystem of Series 2 devices, which runs easily upgradeable Secure Engine (SE) or Virtual Secure Engine (VSE) firmware.

contentItemData.label: AN1244: EFR32 Migration Guide for Proprietary Applications
contentItemData.description: Describes the distinguishing features of different EFR32 families that are most relevant to porting proprietary wireless applications between them. Provides insight that is also helpful when selecting an initial target platform for proprietary wireless solutions.

contentItemData.label: AN1247: Anti-Tamper Protection Configuration and Use

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: How to program, provision, and configure the anti-tamper module on EFR32 Series 2 devices with Secure Vault.

contentItemData.label: AN1252: Building Low Power Networks with the Silicon Labs Connect Stack v3.x
contentItemData.description: Illustrates reducing power consumption in a Connect v3.x application using the sensor example.

contentItemData.label: AN1253: EFR32 Radio Configurator Guide for Simplicity Studio 5
contentItemData.description: Describes the radio configurator GUI for RAIL framework applications in Simplicity Studio 5. With it, you can create standard or custom radio configurations on which to run your RAIL-based applications. The role of each GUI item is explained.

contentItemData.label: AN1268: Authenticating Silicon Labs Devices using Device Certificates

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: How to authenticate an EFR32 Series 2 device with Secure Vault, using secure device certificates and signatures.

contentItemData.label: AN1271: Secure Key Storage

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: How to securely "wrap" keys in EFR32 Series 2 devices with Secure Vault, so they can be stored in non-volatile storage.

contentItemData.label: AN1303: Programming Series 2 Devices Using the Debug Challenge Interface (DCI) and Serial Wire Debug (SWD)

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Describes how to provision and configure Series 2 devices through the DCI and SWD.

contentItemData.label: AN1311: Integrating Crypto Functionality Using PSA Crypto Compared to Mbed TLS

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Describes how to integrate crypto functionality into applications using PSA Crypto compared to Mbed TLS.

contentItemData.label: Transitioning to the Updated Gecko Bootloader in GSDK 4.0 and Higher

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread 32-bit\ MCU HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Gecko Bootloader v2.x, introduced in GSDK 4.0, contains a number of changes compared to Gecko Bootloader v1.x. This document describes the differences between the versions, including how to configure the new Gecko Bootloader in Simplicity Studio 5.

contentItemData.label: AN703: Using Simulated EEPROM Version 1 and Version 2 for the EFR32 Series 1 SoC Platform
contentItemData.description: Describes how to use the simulated EEPROM in Silicon Labs' EM35x and EFR32 Series 1 platforms, gives an overview of the internal design, and discusses design considerations. You should already be familiar with the token system in the HAL. For more information on HAL and the token system, see the online HAL API documentation.

contentItemData.label: AN972: EFR32 RF Evaluation Guide
contentItemData.description: Describes using RAILTest to evaluate radio functionality, as well as peripherals, deep sleep states, etc. With it you can fully evaluate the receiving and transmitting performance and test RF functionality of development kit hardware or custom hardware.

contentItemData.label: Documentation Index
contentItemData.description: Provides an overview and hyperlinks to all packaged documentation.

contentItemData.label: AN1254: Transitioning from the v2.x to the v3.x Proprietary Flex SDK
contentItemData.description: Describes the differences between using Proprietary Flex SDK v2.x in Simplicity Studio 4 and using Proprietary Flex SDK v3.x in Simplicity Studio 5.

contentItemData.label: QSG168: Proprietary Flex SDK v3.x Quick Start Guide
contentItemData.description: Provides basic information on configuring, building, and installing applications using Silicon Labs Connect and RAIL, the two development paths in the Silicon Labs Proprietary Flex SDK v3.x.

contentItemData.label: Silicon Labs Connect API Reference Guide
contentItemData.description: Contains a comprehensive list of APIs used to interface to the Silicon Labs Connect stack.

contentItemData.label: Silicon Labs RAIL API Reference Guide
contentItemData.description: Contains a comprehensive list of APIs used to interface to the Silicon Labs RAIL library.

contentItemData.label: Flex SDK Release Notes
contentItemData.description: Lists compatibility requirements and sources for all software components in the development environment. Discusses the latest changes to the SiliconLabs Flex SDK, including added/deleted/deprecated features/API. Reviews fixed and known issues.

contentItemData.label: Gecko Platform Release Notes

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread Z-Wave 32-bit\ MCU HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: A detailed overview of the changes, additions, and fixes in the Gecko Platform components. The Gecko Platform includes EMLIB, EMDRV, RAIL Library, NVM3, and the component-based infrastructure.

contentItemData.label: UG103.01: Wireless Networking Fundamentals
contentItemData.description: Introduces some fundamental concepts of wireless networking. These concepts are referred to in other Fundamentals documents. If you are new to wireless networking, you should read this document first.

contentItemData.label: UG103.05: IoT Endpoint Security Fundamentals

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread Z-Wave HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Introduces the security concepts that must be considered when implementing an Internet of Things (IoT) system. Using the ioXt Alliance's eight security principles as a structure, it clearly delineates the solutions Silicon Labs provides to support endpoint security and what you must do outside of the Silicon Labs framework.

contentItemData.label: UG103.06: Bootloader Fundamentals

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Introduces bootloading for Silicon Labs networking devices. Discusses the Gecko Bootloader as well as legacy Ember and Bluetooth bootloaders, and describes the file formats used by each.

contentItemData.label: UG103.07: Non-Volatile Data Storage Fundamentals

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Introduces non-volatile data storage using flash and the three different storage implementations offered for Silicon Labs microcontrollers and SoCs: Simulated EEPROM, PS Store, and NVM3.

contentItemData.label: UG103.12: Connect Fundamentals
contentItemData.description: Describes the features and functions of the Silicon Labs Connect stack, including its device types, network topologies, and its 'building block' development methodology using plugins.

contentItemData.label: UG103.13: RAIL Fundamentals
contentItemData.description: Describes the features and functions of Silicon Labs RAIL (Radio Abstraction Interface Layer). RAIL provides an intuitive, easily-customizable radio interface layer that is designed to support proprietary or standards-based wireless protocols.

contentItemData.label: UG103.16: Multiprotocol Fundamentals
contentItemData.description: Describes the four multiprotocol modes, discusses considerations when selecting protocols for multiprotocol implementations, and reviews the Radio Scheduler, a required component of a dynamic multiprotocol solution.

contentItemData.label: UG162: Simplicity Commander Reference Guide

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Describes how and when to use Simplicity Commander's Command-Line Interface.

contentItemData.label: UG305: Dynamic Multiprotocol User's Guide
contentItemData.description: Describes how to implement a dynamic multiprotocol solution.

contentItemData.label: UG409: RAILtest User's Guide
contentItemData.description: Describes the functionality available in the RAILtest application.

contentItemData.label: UG435.01: About the Connect v3.x User's Guide
contentItemData.description: Introduces the Connect User's Guide for the Flex SDK v3.x.

contentItemData.label: UG435.02: Using Silicon Labs Connect v3.x with IEEE 802.15.4
contentItemData.description: Introduces the IEEE 802.15.4 standard on which Connect v3.x is based.

contentItemData.label: UG435.03: Architecture of the Silicon Labs Connect Stack v3.x
contentItemData.description: Describes the architecture of the Silicon Labs Connect stack v3.x an how it implements IEEE 802.15.4.

contentItemData.label: UG435.04: Customizing Applications with Silicon Labs Connect v3.x
contentItemData.description: Describes how to use components, callbacks, and events on top of the Gecko Platform application framework to configure features and application behavior.

contentItemData.label: UG435.05: Using Real Time Operating Systems with Silicon Labs Connect v3.x
contentItemData.description: Describes the process to implement a Connect-based application on top of one of the supported Real Time Operating Systems (RTOS).

contentItemData.label: UG435.06: Bootloading and OTA with Silicon Labs Connect v3.x
contentItemData.description: Explains standalone (serial) and application (OTA) bootloader options available for use within Connect v3.x -based applications

contentItemData.label: UG435.07: Energy Saving with Silicon Labs Connect v3.x
contentItemData.description: Describes the features available in Connect v3.x to reduce power consumption. Using those features is described in AN1252: Building Low Power Networks with the Silicon Labs Connect Stack v3.x.

contentItemData.label: UG460: EFR32 Series 1 Long Range Configuration Reference
contentItemData.description: Introduces the long-range radio profile, escribes its development, and examines underlying details that enable it to realize extended range. Instructions for using example applications are included.

contentItemData.label: UG471: Flex SDK v3.x Range Test Demo User's Guide
contentItemData.description: Provides an easy way to evaluate the link budget of the Wireless Gecko EFR32 devices using Silicon Labs RAIL (RAIL) by performing a range test between two nodes using Range Test, a standalone test application. The range test demo implements Packet Error Rate (PER) measurement.

contentItemData.label: UG489: Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader User's Guide for GSDK 4.0 and Higher

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Describes the high-level implementation of the Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader for EFR32 SoCs and NCPs, and provides information on how to get started using the Gecko Bootloader with Silicon Labs wireless protocol stacks in GSDK 4.0 and higher.
